## Decree No. 75 of 2025
### Regarding the Appointment of Two Non-Resident Ambassadors

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Law No. 21 of 1962 regarding the Diplomatic and Consular Corps System <orig>نظام السلكين الدبلوماسي والقنصلي</orig> and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Succession and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>.
We have decreed the following:
### Article One
Each of the following shall be appointed:
1- Talal Rashid Al-Mansour <orig>طلال راشد المنصور</orig> - Ambassador of the State of Kuwait to the Federative Republic of Brazil - in addition to his current duties - as non-resident Ambassador of the State of Kuwait to Peru.
2- Abdullah Abdul Rahman Al-Shatti <orig>عبد الله عبد الرحمن الشطي</orig> - Ambassador of the State of Kuwait to Romania - in addition to his current duties - as non-resident Ambassador of the State of Kuwait to the Republic of Moldova.
### Article Two
The Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig> shall implement this Decree, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Amir of Kuwait <orig>أمير الكويت</orig>

# Cabinet Resolution <orig>قرار مجلس الوزراء</orig> No. 441 of 2025
## Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship Certificate from an Individual
The Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to May 10, 2024 AD,
- And Article (21 bis "A") of Amiri Decree <orig>المرسوم الأميري</orig> No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law <orig>قانون الجنسية الكويتية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 concerning Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Acting Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية بالنيابة</orig>,
Has resolved
### Article One
The Kuwaiti Citizenship Certificate shall be withdrawn from / Mansour Mohammed Shayie Mohammed Al-Sahli <orig>منصور محمد شايع محمد السهلي</orig>, and Kuwaiti nationality shall be withdrawn from anyone who acquired it through the holder of that certificate by dependency.
### Article Two
The Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية</orig> shall implement this Resolution, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette.
Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>
Fahad Yusuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

# Cabinet Resolution <orig>قرار مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## No. 493 of 2025
### Amending Cabinet Resolution No. 207/First of 2025
### Regarding the Establishment of the Grievance Committee for the Withdrawal and Revocation of Kuwaiti Citizenship

The Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Amiri Decree <orig>المرسوم الأميري</orig> No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law <orig>قانون الجنسية الكويتية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And the Decree issued on 7 Jumada al-Ula 1399 AH, corresponding to 4 April 1979 AD, concerning the Civil Service System <orig>نظام الخدمة المدنية</orig> and its amending decrees,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 concerning Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And Cabinet Resolution <orig>قرار مجلس الوزراء</orig> No. (207/First of 2025) regarding the establishment of the Grievance Committee <orig>لجنة التظلمات</orig> for the withdrawal and revocation of Kuwaiti citizenship,
- And based on the submission of the Acting Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية بالنيابة</orig>,
Has decided:
Article One
The texts of Articles (First, paragraph one, and Second) of the aforementioned Cabinet Resolution No. 207/First of 2025 shall be replaced with the following texts:
(Article First, paragraph one):
((A committee shall be established to consider grievances related to the withdrawal, revocation, and loss of Kuwaiti citizenship, and it shall be affiliated with the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>)).
Article Two:
((The committee shall be responsible for receiving grievances submitted by those whose Kuwaiti citizenship has been withdrawn, revoked, or lost, or from whom the certificate of nationality has been withdrawn, and for considering, examining, studying them, preparing the necessary recommendations regarding them, and submitting proposals within the framework of applicable laws, regulations, and decisions)).
Article Three:
All concerned authorities <orig>الجهات المعنية</orig> shall implement this decision, which shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>
Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1737, Seventy-First Year
71
Sunday, 6 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH - 4/5/2025 AD
</header>

Resolved

### Article One
For the purpose of applying the provisions of this Resolution, the following words shall have the meanings assigned to them respectively:
- **Employer**: Any natural or legal person who employs workers for a wage.
- **Automated Number / Al-Raqm Al-Aali <orig>الرقم الآلي</orig>**: A unique, non-repeating 8-digit number assigned to each unit across the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> to facilitate identifying the unit's location and retrieving its detailed data.
- **Civil ID Number for the Entity / Al-Raqm Al-Madani Lil-Jiha <orig>الرقم المدني للجهة</orig>**: A unique, non-repeating 11-digit number assigned to each entity across the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> to facilitate identifying the entity's data.
- **Commercial Unit / Al-Wahda Al-Tijariya <orig>الوحدة التجارية</orig>**: A space limited by a specific area, subject to increase or decrease, that allows for the practice of any branch of commercial activities as required by the laws and regulations governing commercial licenses in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
- **Unified Headquarters / Al-Maqar Al-Muwahhad <orig>المقر الموحد</orig>**: A single commercial unit bearing more than one civil ID number, used as a shared location for conducting commercial activities by a main company and its subsidiaries, branches, or single-person companies, provided that the regulatory controls and requirements approved by the competent authorities are met, and that the number of licenses used for the headquarters does not exceed five licenses.

### Article Two
Any natural or legal person who owns more than 50% in subsidiaries, branches, single-person companies, or similar entities, has the right to use a single headquarters and more than one automated number <orig>رقم آلي</orig> for the same unit, provided that the number of licenses does not exceed five.

### Article Three
The concerned person must submit an application to the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> through the One-Stop Shop Department / Idarat Al-Nafitha Al-Wahida <orig>إدارة النافذة الواحدة</orig>, accompanied by the lease agreement and the payment receipt including the name of the main natural or legal person.

### Article Four
Companies, natural persons, and legal entities covered by the provisions of this Resolution must obtain the approval of Kuwait Municipality / Baladiyat Al-Kuwait <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> for the commercial unit <orig>الوحدة التجارية</orig>.

Explanatory Memorandum for Ministerial Resolution No. (74) of 2025
Regarding the Controls for Unifying the Headquarters of Commercial Activities
Within the framework of the efforts of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> to enhance the business environment and stimulate investment in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, this resolution was issued as a regulatory step aimed at addressing one of the most prominent challenges facing investors and owners of commercial activities, especially small and medium-sized enterprises, related to the requirements of multiple headquarters and their operational costs.
The resolution stipulates allowing the use of a unified headquarters and automated address number for no more than five licenses, for natural or legal persons who own influential stakes in subsidiary companies, branches, or single-person companies, provided that these activities are administrative or office-based, and it has been determined that they require the approval of headquarters unification in accordance with the building regulations issued in this regard before the approval of headquarters unification.

### Article Five
The Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> shall issue separate civil numbers, with a maximum of five numbers for each entity within the unified headquarters, in accordance with the data of the approved lease contract.

### Article Six
The conditions and controls set by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> regarding the estimation of labor needs shall be observed.

### Article Seven
All other conditions and requirements determined by the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> and the relevant official authorities shall be observed.

### Article Eight
Ministerial Resolution No. (146) of 2023 referred to herein shall be repealed, and any provision that contradicts or violates the provisions of this resolution shall also be repealed.

### Article Nine
All concerned parties – each within its jurisdiction – shall implement this resolution, which shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajeel <orig>خليفة عبدالله العجيل</orig>

## 12: Withdrawal of Service Request (Refund of Paid Fee):
12-1 Without prejudice to the provisions for withdrawing service requests and refunding fees stipulated in the table above, a submitted service request may be withdrawn and the remaining paid portion refunded in accordance with the provisions mentioned below, for some services marked with (**) in the table above. The withdrawal and fee refund do not apply to other services.
12-2 For the service applicant or their legal representative to withdraw the service request, based on a request submitted to the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> stating the reasons for withdrawal, the maximum period is set as the next business day following the day of submitting the service request.
12-3 The withdrawal request shall be decided upon within two business days of its submission. The decision period may be extended if the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> deems it necessary, provided that the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> has not commenced examining the subject of the service.
12-4 The paid fee shall be partially refunded if the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> approves the service withdrawal request, at a rate of 25% of the fee paid for some services listed in the fee schedule.

# Decision No. (77) of 2025
## Regarding
Renewal of Registration of Ms. Hind Abdullah Hamad Al-Saree' <orig>هند عبد الله حمد السريع</orig> in the Special Register for Auditors

**After reviewing:**
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- And the Auditor Registration Certificate of Ms. Hind Abdullah Hamad Al-Saree' <orig>هند عبد الله حمد السريع</orig> No. (EA/2013/0026) issued on 10/05/2022;
- And the request of Ms. Hind Abdullah Hamad Al-Saree' <orig>هند عبد الله حمد السريع</orig> to renew her registration as an auditor in the Special Register with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>;
- And based on Decision No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

**Decided the following:**
### Article One
The registration of auditor Ms. Hind Abdullah Hamad Al-Saree' <orig>هند عبد الله حمد السريع</orig> in the Special Register for Auditors with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> shall be renewed for a period of three years, renewable, effective from 10/05/2025.

### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this Decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Head of the Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>
Issued on: 29 April 2025 AD

# Decision No. (78) of 2025
## Regarding
Renewal of Securities Activities License for Hayat Investment Company <orig>شركة حياة للاستثمار</orig>

**After reviewing:**
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- And the Securities Activities License Certificate for Hayat Investment Company <orig>شركة حياة للاستثمار</orig> No. (AP/2016/0018) issued on 18/07/2022;
- And the request of Hayat Investment Company <orig>شركة حياة للاستثمار</orig> to renew its securities activities license with the Authority;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

**Decided the following:**
### Article One
The securities activity license for Hayat Investment Company <orig>شركة حياة للاستثمار</orig> with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to practice the activity of a securities broker not registered on the stock exchange shall be renewed for a period of three years, renewable, effective from 18/07/2025.

### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this Decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Head of the Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>
Issued on: 29 April 2025 AD

# Decision No. (79) of 2025
## Regarding
Private Marketing License for a Collective Investment Scheme Established Outside the State of Kuwait Granted to Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> for Marketing Shares of Boubyan Islamic Ijara Fund Company <orig>شركة صندوق بوبيان للإجارة الإسلامي</orig>

**After reviewing:**
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- And the Articles of Association and Bylaws of Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>;
- And the agreement concluded between the representative of the collective investment scheme, Ceres Fund Management (Cayman) Limited, and the Marketing Manager, Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>;
- And the request of Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> to undertake the private marketing of shares of Boubyan Islamic Ijara Fund Company <orig>شركة صندوق بوبيان للإجارة الإسلامي</orig>;
- And based on Decision No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1737, Seventy-First Year
</header>

Decided the following:
### Article One
Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> is licensed to privately market 5 million shares (only five million shares) of Boubyan Islamic Ijara Fund Company <orig>شركة صندوق بوبيان للإجارة الإسلامي</orig> (BOUBYAN ISLAMIC IJARA FUND COMPANY) within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, which is established in the Cayman Islands <orig>جزر الكايمان</orig>. The offer price shall be 10 US Dollars <orig>دولار أمريكي</orig> (only ten US Dollars) per share, in addition to a subscription commission of 2.25% payable once upon subscription.

### Article Two
The shares to be marketed within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> shall be offered exclusively to professional clients, as stipulated in Book One (Definitions) <orig>الكتاب الأول (التعريفات)</orig> of the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of Law No. 7 of 2010 <orig>القانون رقم 7 لسنة 2010</orig> regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities and their amendments. The entities authorized to receive subscription requests are:
- Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>.
- Boubyan Bank <orig>بنك بوبيان</orig>.

### Article Three
The objectives of the collective investment scheme <orig>نظام الاستثمار الجماعي</orig> shall be determined based on what is stated in the subscription prospectus <orig>نشرة الاكتتاب</orig>.

### Article Four
The marketing license <orig>رخصة التسويق</orig> shall be valid for one year, renewable annually, commencing from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate <orig>شهادة ترخيص الهيئة</orig> and after payment of the prescribed fees <orig>الرسوم المقررة</orig>.

### Article Five
The prescribed fees <orig>الرسوم المقررة</orig> shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this decision. In the event of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the decision shall be considered null and void.

### Article Six
The competent authorities <orig>الجهات المختصة</orig> shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

<footer>
Head of Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب الفليج</orig>

# Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>
## Administrative Decision No. 78 / GM 2025 regarding a cooperation agreement between the office / Al-Tasamim Engineering Consultations Group <orig>مجموعة التصاميم للاستشارات الهندسية</orig> - owned by Engineer / Ismail Abdul Karim Abdul Reda Abdul Karim <orig>إسماعيل عبد الكريم عبد الرضا عبد الكريم</orig> and the office / Fajr Engineering Consultations <orig>فجر للاستشارات الهندسية</orig> - owned by Engineer / Fajr Abdul Latif Al-Hindi <orig>فجر عبد اللطيف الهندي</orig>

Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>
- And pursuant to Ministerial Decision No. (2016/33) regarding Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> and its amendments.
- And pursuant to Ministerial Decision No. (2021/123) issuing the Professional Practice Regulations for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms <orig>لائحة مزاولة المهنة للمكاتب الهندسية والدور الاستشارية</orig> and its amendments.
- And pursuant to Ministerial Decision No. (2009/363) regarding the organization of the Municipality's Executive Body <orig>الجهاز التنفيذي للبلدية</orig> and its branches in the governorates.
- And pursuant to Ministerial Decision No. (2009/206) regarding the regulation of construction works and its annexed schedules dated 30/4/2009 and its amendments.
- And pursuant to Administrative Decision No. (A2024/781) dated 27/5/2024 regarding the re-formation of the Committee for Regulating the Practice of the Profession for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms <orig>لجنة تنظيم مزاولة المهنة للمكاتب الهندسية والدور الاستشارية</orig>.
- And pursuant to Administrative Decision No. (2022/161) dated 15/6/2022 regarding the renewal of registration for the office / Al-Tasamim Engineering Consultations <orig>التصاميم للاستشارات الهندسية</orig> owned by Engineer / Ismail Abdul Karim Abdul Reda Abdul Karim <orig>إسماعيل عبد الكريم عبد الرضا عبد الكريم</orig>.
- And pursuant to Administrative Decision No. (2025/80) dated 22/4/2025 regarding the renewal of registration for the office / Fajr Engineering Consultations <orig>فجر للاستشارات الهندسية</orig> owned by / Fajr Abdul Latif Al-Hindi <orig>فجر عبد اللطيف الهندي</orig>.
- And pursuant to the letter from the Committee for Professional Practice for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms <orig>لجنة مزاولة المهنة للمكاتب الهندسية والدور الاستشارية</orig> No. (00007-2025) dated 27/3/2025.
- And pursuant to the Committee's recommendation in its meeting No. (2025/4) held on 19/3/2025 regarding the aforementioned agreement.

## Decision No. (80) of 2025
### Regarding
Renewal of the Collective Investment Scheme License for Boubyan Money Market Fund II <orig>صندوق بوبيان للسوق النقدي بالدينار الكويتي الثاني</orig> in Kuwaiti Dinars

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, its executive regulations, and amendments;
- And the Collective Investment Scheme License Certificate for Boubyan Money Market Fund II <orig>صندوق بوبيان للسوق النقدي بالدينار الكويتي الثاني</orig> in Kuwaiti Dinars No. (LCIS/2016/0006) issued on 2/8/2022;
- And the request from Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> to renew the license for Boubyan Money Market Fund II <orig>صندوق بوبيان للسوق النقدي بالدينار الكويتي الثاني</orig> in Kuwaiti Dinars;
- And based on Decision No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval authorities for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig> issued on 12/01/2025.

It has been decided as follows:
### Article One
The Collective Investment Scheme License for Boubyan Money Market Fund II <orig>صندوق بوبيان للسوق النقدي بالدينار الكويتي الثاني</orig> in Kuwaiti Dinars shall be renewed for a period of three years, renewable, effective from 1/8/2025.

### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Head of the Supervision Sector <orig>رئيس قطاع الإشراف</orig>
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>

# Insurance Regulation Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>
## Resolution No. (6) of 2025
Regarding Entities that have Regularized their Status
in Accordance with the Law, its Executive Regulations, and their Amendments
Chairman of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulation Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>:
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance, its Executive Regulations, and their Amendments,
- And Resolution No. (14) of 2022 regarding applications for issuing licenses to practice insurance activities and insurance professions,
- And based on the decision of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulation Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> at its meeting No. (3) of 2025 dated 27/4/2025 AD,
Has resolved the following:
Article One
Entities that have regularized their status, as detailed in this Article, are licensed to practice the following activities:

<table_caption>Licensed Entities and Their Activities</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Name of Licensee | Entity Classification | Licensed Activities to Practice |
|:--|:---|:---|:---|
| 1 | Serenity Insurance Brokerage Company <orig>شركة سيرنتي لوساطة التأمين</orig> | National | Insurance Professions - Insurance Brokerage Activity |
| 2 | Hujoon Insurance Brokerage Company <orig>شركة هوجون لوساطة التأمين</orig> | National | Insurance Professions - Insurance Brokerage Activity |
</table>

The duration of the license to practice the activity shall be (three years), commencing from the date of issuance of this Resolution. The aforementioned entities are obligated to pay the prescribed fees for granting the practice license, or upon its renewal for any other period, in accordance with Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments, and the resolutions and circulars issued by the Unit in this regard.

Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this Resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.
Chairman of the Supreme Committee
Mohammed Sulaiman Al-Otaiji <orig>محمد سليمان العتيجي</orig>

# Decision No. (7) of 2025
## Regarding the Approval of Final Cessation

Chairman of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulatory Unit:
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (125) of 2019 concerning Insurance Regulation and its Executive Regulations and amendments,
- And Decision No. (14) of 2022 concerning applications for issuing licenses to practice insurance activities and insurance professions,
- And Decision No. (28) of 2023 regarding licensing companies that have regularized their status in accordance with the Law and its Executive Regulations and amendments,
- And based on the request submitted by Mr. Naveen Gorawath Sushil Kumar Gorawath <orig>نافين غوراواث سوشيل كومار غوراواث</orig> on 2025/02/20,
- And based on the decision of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulatory Unit at its meeting No. (3) of 2025 on 2025/4/27,

Has decided the following:
### Article One
Approval of the request to cancel the practice license for Mr. Naveen Gorawath Sushil Kumar Gorawath <orig>نافين غوراواث سوشيل كومار غوراواث</orig>, Actuarial Expert – Natural Person – Employee of Al-Ahliya Insurance Company <orig>الشركة الأهلية للتأمين</orig>.

### Article Two

Chairman of the Supreme Committee
Mohammed Sulaiman Al-Otaibi <orig>محمد سليمان العتيبي</orig>

# Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>
## Decision No. (26) of 2025
Regarding the acquisition by Al-Yousifi Foods Company (L.L.C.) <orig>شركة اليسرة للأغذية</orig> of 51% of the shares of La Maison du Fromage General Trading for Foodstuffs Company (L.L.C.) <orig>شركة لاميزون دو فروماج للتجارة العامة للمواد الغذائية</orig>
Chairman of the Board of Directors:
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (72) of 2020 regarding Competition Protection,
- Decree No. (238) of 2017 appointing members of the Board of Directors of the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>,
- Decision No. (14) of 2021 issuing the Executive Regulations of Law No. (72) of 2020 regarding Competition Protection, and its amendments,
- Economic Concentration Process No. (CPACNM000492024) regarding the acquisition by Al-Yousifi Foods Company (L.L.C.) <orig>شركة اليسرة للأغذية</orig> of 51% of the shares of La Maison du Fromage General Trading for Foodstuffs Company (L.L.C.) <orig>شركة لاميزون دو فروماج للتجارة العامة للمواد الغذائية</orig>,
- The Executive Management's report on the aforementioned economic concentration process,
- The approval of the Board of Directors at its 98th meeting held on 2025/4/16,
- And based on the requirements of public interest.
It has been decided
### Article One
Approval of Economic Concentration Process No. (CPACNM000492024) regarding the acquisition by Al-Yousifi Foods Company (L.L.C.) <orig>شركة اليسرة للأغذية</orig> of 51% of the shares of La Maison du Fromage General Trading for Foodstuffs Company (L.L.C.) <orig>شركة لاميزون دو فروماج للتجارة العامة للمواد الغذائية</orig>.
### Article Two
The competent authorities – each within its jurisdiction – shall implement this decision, notify all parties of this decision, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

# Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>
## Resolution No. 48/1-R/2025

Governor of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>

Having reviewed Articles (21) and (61) of Law No. (32) of 1968 regarding Currency, the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>, and the Regulation of the Banking Profession, and its amendments.
And Articles (4), (5), and (7) of Ministerial Resolution No. (40) of 2003 concerning the Regulations of the Register of Islamic Banks at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>.
And based on the resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assemblies of the shareholders of Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig> held on 16/3/2025.
And pursuant to the request of Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig> dated 26/3/2025 regarding the amendment of its data in the Register of Islamic Banks at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>.

Has resolved

### Article One

The following amendments to the data of Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig> shall be recorded in the Register of Islamic Banks at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>:
- Increase in authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from 1,710,844,747 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> to 1,847,712,327 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, with the increase representing 8% of the capital as bonus shares.
- Increase in legal reserve from 4,076,627,494 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> to 4,795,879,270 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (including a share premium of 4,267,446,770 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
- Increase in voluntary reserve from 261,993,074 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> to 269,553,417 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. This is in accordance with the bank's final financial statements for the fiscal year ended 31/12/2024.
- Reappointment of their Excellencies as members of the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الفتوى والرقابة الشرعية</orig> for the fiscal year ending 31/12/2025, as follows:
  * Dr. Sayed Mohammed Al-Sayed Abdul Razzaq Al-Tabatabaei <orig>الدكتور سيد محمد السيد عبدالرزاق الطباطبائي</orig>
  * Dr. Anwar Shuaib Abdul Salam <orig>الدكتور أنور شعيب عبدالسلام</orig>
  * Dr. Mubarak Jazaa Al-Harbi <orig>الدكتور مبارك جزاء الحربي</orig>
  * Dr. Khalid Shujaa Al-Otaibi <orig>الدكتور خالد شجاع العتيبي</orig>
  * Dr. Essam Abdul Rahim Al-Ghareeb <orig>الدكتور عصام عبدالرحيم الغريب</orig>
- Appointment of Mr. Bader Adel Al-Abduljader <orig>بدر عادل العبدالجادر</orig> from Al-Aiban, Al-Osaimi & Partners (Ernst & Young), and reappointment of Mr. Bader Abdullah Al-Wazzan <orig>بدر عبدالله الوزان</orig> from Al-Wazzan & Partners (Deloitte & Touche) as auditors for the bank's accounts for the fiscal year ending 31/12/2025.

### Article Two

This resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall be effective from the date of its issuance.

The Governor

<footer>
Issued on: 24 Shawwal 1446 AH
Corresponding to: 22 April 2025 AD

## Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>
### Announcement
The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> announces the launch of Tender No. 916/A for the year: 2025-2026, concerning the supply, installation, operation, maintenance, and warranty of LED lighting for the Ministry of Information Complex buildings and external signboards, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the tender documents. # Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## Addendum Correction

A material error occurred during the publication of the decision of the Supreme Committee for Kuwaiti Nationality <orig>اللجنة العليا لتحقيق الجنسية الكويتية</orig> No. (67 / 2 – 2025) issued on April 10, 2025 AD, regarding the loss of Kuwaiti nationality, which was published in the Official Gazette, supplement to Issue 1735, dated April 21, 2025.
The error was stated as: Acting Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior, Chairman of the Supreme Committee for Kuwaiti Nationality <orig>اللجنة العليا لتحقيق الجنسية الكويتية</orig>.
The correct statement is: First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior, Chairman of the Supreme Committee for Kuwaiti Nationality <orig>اللجنة العليا لتحقيق الجنسية الكويتية</orig>.
Therefore, we are re-publishing the decision with the correction.

# Decision of the Supreme Committee for the Verification of Kuwaiti Nationality
## No. (67 – 7 / 2) for the year 2025 AD
### Regarding the Loss of Kuwaiti Nationality

Having reviewed the Constitution,
And Article (10) of Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959, concerning the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
And after the approval of the Supreme Committee for the Verification of Kuwaiti Nationality,
We have decided the following:

### Article One

Kuwaiti nationality shall be lost by:

<table_caption>Individuals Losing Kuwaiti Nationality</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Name | Reference Number |
|:--|:---|:---|
| 1 | Fatima Hussein Ali Gholoum Hussein <orig>فاطمة حسين علي غلوم حسين</orig> | 102555705 |
| 2 | Laila Hussein Ali Gholoum Hussein <orig>ليلى حسين علي غلوم حسين</orig> | 102801011 |
</table>

This is based on Article (10) of Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959, referred to above.

### Article Two

The concerned authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

First Deputy Prime Minister
And Minister of Interior
Chairman of the Supreme Committee for the Verification of Kuwaiti Nationality
Fahad Yusuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Issued on: 12 Shawwal 1446 AH
Corresponding to: 10 April 2025 AD

The Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> ensures that there is no suspension on the tender file for government contracts registered with the Authority regarding any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector, noting that bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded.
- This announcement is considered an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as interested companies have the right to attend the bid opening session.
- Interested companies wishing to attend must coordinate with the Bid Opening Department <orig>قسم فض العطاءات</orig> before the date set for the bid opening session and bring the following documents:
1. Copy of the Civil ID <orig>البطاقة المدنية</orig>.
2. Copy of the signature authorization from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
3. In case of attendance by a person other than the authorized signatory, a written letter of authorization must be presented from the authorized signatory to the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>, delegating whomever they deem fit to attend the session.

Regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. 49/2016.
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> wishing to apply for the tender must attach with their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise with the Fund.
- This announcement is considered an integral part of the tender documents.
- For more information, please visit our website WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW

## Meeting Minutes No. (2025/38)
### Held on Monday Morning
30 Shawwal 1446 AH – Corresponding to 28-04-2025 AD
The Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> held its session No. (2025/38) at nine o'clock on Monday morning, 28-04-2025, with the presence of the following gentlemen:

# Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig>
## Announcement

The Higher Purchasing Committee for Tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its oil companies (H.P.C), based on the request of Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig> (PIC), announces the issuance of Tender No.: MNA/38/2024 regarding Supplying Gusseted Tube FFS Bag Film To PP Plant.

<table_caption>Tender Details for Supplying Gusseted Tube FFS Bag Film To PP Plant</table_caption>
<table>
| Closing Date | Issuance Date | Document Value | Initial Guarantee |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 2025/06/03   | 2025/05/04 | 500 KD      | 15,000 KD      |
</table>

- This tender is general and indivisible, conditional upon the submission of a document attached below.
- Brief description of the tender works: Supplying Gusseted Tube FFS Bag Film To PP Plant – General Tender
- The tender closing time is at 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 2025/06/03. Bids must be submitted via the Unified Electronic Platform for the Oil Sector (K-Tendering). No copy of the bid shall be sent to any other party except the aforementioned platform, otherwise, the bid will be considered void. The validity period of the bid shall be (90) days from the date of opening the bids. No bids will be accepted after the specified deadline.
- The preliminary meeting will be held at 10:00 AM on Tuesday, 2025/05/20, noting that the meeting will be held virtually (Virtual Meeting).
- An initial guarantee <orig>تأمين أولي</orig> in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig>, with a value of (15,000/-) Fifteen Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, for the same validity period of the bid. The original guarantee must be submitted sufficiently before the closing date, provided that a soft copy is attached with the bid.
- The original initial bank guarantee, whose value is stated in this announcement, must be submitted to the Sub-Committee for Opening Bids <orig>اللجنة الفرعية لفض مظاريف العطاءات</orig> before the specified tender closing deadline, at the company's main headquarters in South Sabahiya <orig>جنوب الصباحية</orig>, Office No. (CG-112), with a soft copy required to be attached with the bid.
- The last date for submitting any inquiries, reservations, or requests from participating companies regarding this tender is 2025/05/22. These requests will not be considered for any reason after this specified deadline.
- The purchase value of the document is (500) Five Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- Documents can be purchased via bank deposit into the account of Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig>, with the necessity of clearly adding the aforementioned tender number and the name of the purchasing company on the deposit slip issued by the bank, according to the following details:

1- Account Name: Petrochemical Industries Company
Banker's Name: National Bank of Kuwait, Ahmadi Branch, Kuwait
IBAN #: KW77NBOK0000000000001003811717
KD Call Account No.: 1003811717
Swift Code: NBOKKWKW

2- Account Name: Petrochemical Industries Company
Banker's Name: National Bank of Kuwait, Head Office, Kuwait
IBAN #: KW22NBOK0000000000001000312850
US $ Account No.: 1000312850
Swift Code: NBOKKWKW

To be submitted with the bid:
1. Copy of the initial guarantee <orig>التأمين الأولي</orig> (certified check) or letter of guarantee.
2. Copy of the signature authorization <orig>اعتماد التوقيع</orig> (letter of authorization for signatories).

9. A certificate from the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> stating that there are no tax restrictions on the company, and a list of local agencies represented by the company, with supporting evidence attached.

11. Any changes to the tender will be announced through Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> newspaper and/or the company's website www.pic.com.kw
* To contact the company's contracts team via email contracts_team@pic.com.kw or by phone at 23851389.

Prequalification Requirements for a Public Tender regarding the Supply of Gusseted Tube FFS Bag Film Rolls for Polypropylene Product

1. The supplier must have experience in supplying and manufacturing packaging bag rolls for polypropylene product, with a list of customer names attached.
2. The supplier must own a factory in Kuwait or in the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries for manufacturing packaging bag rolls for polypropylene product. A commercial registration certificate must be attached.
3. The factory's production capacity for packaging bags must not be less than 700 tons per year. A certificate to that effect must be attached.
4. The factory must include quality laboratories for measuring product specifications.
5. No penalties, sanctions, or violations must have been previously applied against the supplier by the Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig>.
6. The supplier must have their own means of transportation to supply the product to the polypropylene plant.
7. The supplier shall provide a sample of approximately 100 kg that complies with the specifications determined by the Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig> for testing 12 days before the closing date. The sample shall be delivered to the company's polypropylene plant in Shuaikh Industrial Area <orig>منطقة الشويخ الصناعية</orig> through the gate of Equate Petrochemical Company <orig>شركة إيكويت لصناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig> with a receipt of delivery. The supplier shall then submit this receipt with the bid form.
8. The supplier's requirements checklist attached with the tender documents must be filled out.

Gusseted Tube bag film Requirements
1- The Supplier shall have experience in manufacturing and
delivering of Gusseted Tube FFS bag film for Polypropylene product.
Customer reference list to be attached.
2- The Supplier shall have a plant (Factory) for Gusseted Tube bag
Film manufacturing in Kuwait or Gulf Cooperation Council Member
Countries GCC only. The Supplier must provide the "Commercial
Registration Certificate".
3- The Plant (factory) has a production capacity of more than 700
metric ton/year of Gusseted Tube FFS bag Film. The Supplier must
provide the Plant designed capacity data sheet.
4- The Factory shall have Quality laboratories for product quality
analysis.
5- No penalties or violations have previously been applied against
the Supplier by the Petrochemical Industries Company (PIC).
6- Supplier shall have his own means of transportation to supply the
product to Polypropylene plant.
7- The Supplier shall provide a sample of 100 kg of Gusseted Tube
bag film roll that fulfilling Petrochemical Industries Company (PIC)
Specification's sheet before 12 days from tender closing date for
testing it. The sample to be handed in Polypropylene plant in Shuaiba
Industrial Area through Equate Petrochemical Company gate.
Supplier and the Supplier shall submit this receipt with his bid.
8- Supplier shall fill the check list of Gusseted Tube bag film
Requirements that attached with tender documents.

*   Preserving the condition of roads, facilities, infrastructure, and public utilities in the mentioned areas, which will bring economic benefits to the State.
*   Purchasing building materials locally will increase trade, buying, selling, and raw material circulation opportunities. During normal construction phases, the effects are positive, direct, spatially specific, and short-term, with significant overall importance for the economy and employment.
*   Operating the project will achieve indirect economic gains by reducing maintenance costs for the State's roads and public utilities due to their protection from flood effects, and it will also extend the design life of these facilities.
*   Protecting the environment by preventing the accumulation of rainwater, whether within the area or in surrounding areas where water might collect due to the absence of an integrated and safe rainwater drainage network.

**Scope of Work:**
The project is located in existing and future urban infrastructure areas, distributed across various lands of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, covering the northern, southern, and western regions. This project aims to implement permanent protection for these areas from flood risks, to avoid the repercussions and damages resulting from floods coming from outside these areas, through a set of radical solutions that will absorb flows before they reach these cities. These solutions include implementing permanent measures <orig>خبرات</orig> according to environmental standards, a series of dams and water channels to divert floodwaters away from these cities, in addition to measures <orig>خبرات</orig> for draining excess rainwater network.

Name: Management, Operation, and Maintenance of Sheikh Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah Bridge <orig>جسر الشيخ جابر الأحمد الصباح</orig>
Detailed Objectives: Management, operation, and maintenance of Sheikh Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah Bridge <orig>جسر الشيخ جابر الأحمد الصباح</orig>, including all bridge components implemented by the construction contractor, and monitoring and maintaining the bridges by removing moisture and lifting devices, and conducting a comprehensive and periodic inspection of bridge components to ensure structural integrity, functional performance, and public safety.
Scope of Work: Operation and maintenance of related facilities <orig>أهالي</orig> and operation of truck weighing station buildings, the Sheikh Visitor Center building, and the Roads Authority building in Doha <orig>الدوحة</orig>. Operation and maintenance works include cleaning, fire fighting, management of the rainwater drainage network, sewage network, security, and waste management in coordination with relevant authorities, and provision of potable water. Operation and maintenance of the bridge includes periodic cleaning of the road surface, including all bridge components implemented by the construction contractor, and monitoring and maintaining the bridges by removing moisture and lifting devices, and conducting a comprehensive and periodic inspection of bridge components to ensure structural integrity, functional performance, and public safety. Operation and maintenance of roads includes cleaning road components, wastewater treatment for floating marine facilities, operation of marine facilities, maintenance of the navigation channel, monitoring and preparation of environmental monitoring reports, removal of sand accumulation, preparation of environmental monitoring reports during the operation phase, and monitoring of settlement for residential areas, Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ</orig>, and the North and South Gulf Islands. Operation and maintenance of all electrical systems and supply of necessary spare parts.
Method of Offering: Public Tender (Divisibility/Alternative Offers/Samples)

**National Leasing and Finance Company K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة الوطنية للإجارة والتمويل ش. م. ك. (مقفلة)</orig>**
**Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting**

The Extraordinary General Assembly of National Leasing and Finance Company K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة الوطنية للإجارة والتمويل ش. م. ك. (مقفلة)</orig> held its extraordinary meeting at 12:00 PM on Wednesday, 23/4/2025, at the company's headquarters in Al-Mirqab <orig>المرقاب</orig> – Block 3, Omar Bin Al-Khattab Street <orig>شارع عمر بن الخطاب</orig> – K.B.T Tower – 25th Floor – Meeting Room, with the attendance of:
*   Mr. Salem Khader Mohammed Al-Masawi <orig>سالم خضر محمد المساوى</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors
*   Shareholders holding shares in person and by proxy, representing 87.23% of the total share capital of the company, amounting to 416,084,680 shares.

After announcing the availability of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, Mr. Salem Khader Al-Masawi <orig>سالم خضر المساوى</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors – opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees, and then proceeded to present the item on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly for discussion. The following was approved and endorsed by the attending shareholders:
Item One: Approval was given to amend Article No. (15) of the Company's Articles of Association and its amendments.

### Text Before Amendment:

The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (5) five members, from whom the entity or entities authorized to second representatives to the Board of Directors shall appoint members in proportion to their shareholding in the company, and the General Assembly shall elect the remaining members by secret ballot.

### Text After Amendment:

The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (5) five members, from whom the entity or entities authorized to second representatives to the Board of Directors shall appoint members in proportion to their shareholding in the company, and the General Assembly shall elect the remaining members by secret ballot.
Provided that the Board includes one or more independent members who meet the conditions required by regulatory bodies and possess qualifications, experience, and skills commensurate with the company's activity. They shall be chosen by the Ordinary General Assembly, and their remuneration shall be determined according to governance rules, provided that their number does not exceed half of the Board members and is not less than 20% of the total number of Board members. It is not required for an independent member to be a shareholder in the company, and it should be noted that the term of membership for an independent member ends with the conclusion of the Board's term for which they were chosen.

*   The Extraordinary General Assembly session concluded at 12:30 PM on the same day, and Mr. Salem Khader Al-Masawi <orig>سالم خضر المساوى</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors, thanked the attending shareholders, extending best wishes for the company's progress and prosperity.

Chairman of the Board of Directors

## Minutes of the Annual Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
### For the Financial Year Ended December 31, 2024

The Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of Real Estate Trade Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>الشركة التجارية العقارية (ش.م.ك.ع.)</orig> was held on Monday, April 21, 2024, at 11:35 AM, immediately following the Ordinary General Assembly Meeting. The meeting, held physically and electronically at the company's headquarters – Sharq, Jaber Al-Mubarak Street, Meeting Room, Second Floor – was chaired by Mr. Abdul Fattah Mohammed Rafi Ma'rafi <orig>عبد الفتاح محمد رفيع معرفي</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors. This was in response to the invitation announced in local newspapers, on the company's website, the notification letter issued by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, and the disclosures from Boursa Kuwait <orig>بورصة الكويت</orig> and the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>.

    Mr. Fouad Hassan Darwish <orig>فؤاد حسن درويش</orig> - Head of Accounting Department

Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Sunday, April 27, 2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Tamdeen Real Estate Development Company <orig>شركة التمدين للتطوير العقاري</orig> held its meeting on Sunday, 27/04/2025, at 11:30 AM, at the meeting hall in the company's headquarters, 360 Mall - Fourth Floor, chaired by Mr. Moath Bishr Al-Roumi <orig>معاذ بشر الرومي</orig> - Chairman of the Board of Directors, and attended by Mr. Mohammed Al-Khawwas <orig>محمد الخواص</orig>, representative of Gulf Custody Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>.

The Chairman of the session opened the meeting by welcoming the attendees and announced the presence of shareholders holding 170,000,000 shares by proxy, representing 100% of the total company shares, and called for discussion of the agenda items and approval of the following:

*The amendment of Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (4) of the Articles of Association regarding the company's objectives was approved.

## Text Before Amendment:

1- Owning, selling, purchasing, and developing real estate and land for the company's account inside and outside the State of Kuwait, as well as managing third-party properties, all in compliance with the provisions stipulated in existing laws and what they prohibit regarding trading in private residential plots as specified by these laws.
2- Owning, selling, and purchasing shares and bonds of real estate companies solely for the company's account in Kuwait and abroad.
3- Preparing studies and providing consultations in all types of real estate fields, provided that the required conditions are met by those who provide this service.
4- Carrying out maintenance work related to buildings and properties owned by the company and third parties, including maintenance work, and executing civil, mechanical, electrical, elevator, and air conditioning works to ensure the preservation and safety of buildings.
5- Organizing real estate exhibitions for the company's real estate projects, in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry.
6- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
7- Direct contribution to establishing infrastructure for residential, commercial, and industrial areas and projects under the "Build-Operate-Transfer" (BOT) system, and managing real estate facilities under the (BOT) system.
8- Owning and managing hotels, health clubs, and tourist facilities, and leasing and renting them.
9- Managing, operating, investing, leasing, and renting hotels, clubs, motels, guesthouses, rest houses, parks, gardens, exhibitions, restaurants, cafeterias, residential complexes, tourist and health resorts, recreational and sports projects, and facilities of various grades and levels, including all original and auxiliary services, attached facilities, and other necessary services.
10- Conducting real estate auctions in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry.
11- Owning and managing commercial markets and residential complexes.
The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities engaged in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad. It may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such entities.

1. Amendment of Article (5) of the Articles of Association and Article (4) of the Bylaws:

### Text of the Article Before Amendment:
The purposes for which the company was established are the creation of cinemas in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, their operation, the import, production, and distribution of films of all types and sizes, their export, leasing, and sale to others, the import of all necessary machinery and equipment for the cinema industry, and trading in them, as well as in films, photographic equipment, display equipment, and furniture, encompassing comprehensively all that may be included or used for the cinema industry. This also includes participating in all governmental or private tenders that fall within its purposes. The company also has the right to agree with theatrical, musical, and entertainment troupes inside or outside Kuwait to hold events, provided that their presence does not conflict with the country's laws and regulations. The company has the right to lease cinemas to governmental and private entities and to event organizers. In general, the company specializes in all matters related to cinema and its accessories, including aspects of education, entertainment, and intellectual activity in Kuwait and abroad.
The company may also establish, operate, and utilize theatrical venues, and import all necessary machinery, equipment, and devices for this activity. It may utilize and lease commercial shops, restaurants, cafes, and entertainment arcades in cinema and theater buildings, manage and operate media, visual, and audio means, and undertake publishing, distribution, and media activities. The company may carry out its purposes directly, by leasing to others, or by agency on behalf of others. It may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities engaged in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its purposes, and it may establish, participate in, or affiliate with such entities. The company shall carry out all its purposes inside and outside Kuwait.
Utilizing the financial surpluses available to the company by investing them in financial and real estate portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities. The company may manage, operate, and equip restaurants, cafes, and ready meals, own movable and immovable properties necessary for carrying out its activities within the limits permitted by law, and engage in the retail sale of gifts and accessories, Activity Code 477367.

## MEC Food Company (K.S.C.)
### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly of the company convened at the company's head office in Sharq <orig>شرق</orig> Area 4, Tower 21, 11th Floor, at 12:00 PM (noon) on Sunday, 20/04/2025, with the presence of Mr. Mohammed Bandar Al-Hawwas <orig>محمد بندر الحواس</orig> representing Gulf Custody Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>. After the announcement of the legal quorum for the validity of the meeting, and with 86.1667% of the company's shares present, the following was discussed:
Approval of the amendment of Article (5) of the Articles of Incorporation and Article (4) of the Articles of Association to read as follows:
Text Before Amendment:-
The purposes for which the company was established are to carry out the following:
1- Management and operation of all food catering services in restaurants, hospitals, schools, universities, companies, factories, camps, parks, residential cooperative societies, clubs, institutes, amusement parks, guesthouses, residences, theaters, cinemas, recreational, sports, and tourism projects, hotels and their annexed facilities, and other necessary services, whether directly or indirectly, or on behalf of third parties.
2- Manufacturing of food, beverages, and other food and consumer goods (after obtaining the approval of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>), importing, selling, packaging, storing, and distributing them in a manner deemed appropriate by the company, whether wholesale or retail.
3- Opening and managing restaurants, including fast-food restaurants.
4- Purchasing and importing necessary devices, supplies, and equipment for the implementation of the company's purposes.
5- Accepting companies and participating in tenders similar to these purposes.
6- Owning movable and immovable properties necessary for carrying out its activities within the limits permitted by law.
7- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
8- Representing foreign companies in the aforementioned fields.
The company shall have the right to carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either as a principal or as an agent. The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or abroad. It may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such entities.

Text before amendment:
A member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must personally own, or the legal entity <orig>الشخص المعنوي</orig> they represent must own, a number of shares whose value is not less than 7,500 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> or 1% of the capital, whichever is less. Text after amendment:

# Al-Sour Fuel Marketing Company (K.S.C.P.) <orig>شركة السور لتسويق الوقود (ش.م.ك) عامة</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting (Adjourned)
The Extraordinary General Assembly (Adjourned) of the shareholders of Al-Sour Fuel Marketing Company (K.S.C.P.) <orig>شركة السور لتسويق الوقود (ش.م.ك)</orig> held its meeting at the company's main headquarters located in Al-Mirqab <orig>المرقاب</orig> – Omar Bin Al-Khattab Street <orig>شارع عمر بن الخطاب</orig> – Kuwait Business City Tower <orig>برج مدينة الأعمال الكويتية</orig> – 25th Floor, at 12:00 PM on Sunday, April 27, 2025, in the presence of:
*   Mr. Tareef Mohammed Baqer Al-Awadhi <orig>طريف محمد باقر العوضي</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors
*   Mr. Talal Ahmed Al-Khars <orig>طلال أحمد الخرس</orig> – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer.
*   Mr. Omar Khalil Ahmed <orig>عمر خليل أحمد</orig> – Representative of Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>
*   Shareholders representing: 292,563,933 shares, constituting 72.311% of the company's total capital shares of 404,707,580 shares, through direct attendance in addition to attendance via the electronic system for participation in general assemblies specific to Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>.
After the announcement of the completion of the legal quorum for holding the meeting, Mr. Tareef Mohammed Baqer Al-Awadhi <orig>طريف محمد باقر العوضي</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors, opened the session, and the Extraordinary General Assembly commenced its work by discussing the agenda. The Assembly unanimously approved the following, with the shares represented at the meeting:
1- Approval was granted for the increase of the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 40,470,758.000 (only forty million, four hundred seventy thousand, seven hundred fifty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars) to KWD 42,089,588.300 (only forty-two million, eighty-nine thousand, five hundred eighty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars and 300 fils), an increase of KWD 1,618,830.300 (only one million, six hundred eighteen thousand, eight hundred thirty Kuwaiti Dinars and 300 fils) through free bonus shares totaling 16,188,303 (only sixteen million, one hundred eighty-eight thousand, three hundred three shares) with a nominal value of 100 fils per share, which will be distributed to the shareholders registered in the company's records on the entitlement date at a percentage of 4% of the company's total capital, at a rate of 4 shares for every 100 shares, and authorizing the Board of Directors to implement this resolution and dispose of fractional shares, if any.
2- Approval was granted for the amendment of Article No. (7) of the Articles of Incorporation and Article (6) of the Company's Articles of Association to become as follows:
Text of the two articles before amendment:
"The company's capital is set at KWD 40,470,758.000 (only forty million, four hundred seventy thousand, seven hundred fifty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars), distributed over 404,707,580 shares (only four hundred four million, seven hundred seven thousand, five hundred eighty shares), with a value of 100 fils (one hundred fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares."
Text of the two articles after amendment:
"The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is set at KWD 42,089,588.300 (only forty-two million, eighty-nine thousand, five hundred eighty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars and 300 fils), distributed over 420,895,883 shares (only four hundred twenty million, eight hundred ninety-five thousand, eight hundred eighty-three shares), with a value of 100 fils (one hundred fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares."

(Text after amendment) –
Net profits shall be distributed as follows:
First: (10%) shall be deducted for the allocation of the statutory reserve account. The General Assembly may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's capital.
Second: (5%) of the net profits shall be deducted for the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>, as per the decree dated 12/12/1976.
Third: Another percentage, proposed by the Board of Directors and approved annually by the General Assembly, shall be deducted and allocated to the voluntary reserve account. This deduction shall cease by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on the Board of Directors' proposals.
Fourth: A portion of the profits shall be deducted, based on the proposal of the Board of Directors and the General Assembly, to meet the company's obligations under labor laws. These funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
Fifth: Subject to the provisions contained in the company's articles of association, the Ordinary General Assembly may, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the fiscal year or the end of each financial period. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and this distribution shall not affect the company's paid-up capital.
Sixth: After the foregoing, an amount approved by the Ordinary General Assembly, not exceeding (10%) of the remainder, shall be deducted and allocated as remuneration for the Board of Directors.
Seventh: The remaining profits shall then be distributed to shareholders as an additional share in profits, or carried forward to the next year based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, or allocated to establish an extraordinary reserve fund or depreciation fund.
3) Third item on the agenda:
Amendment of Article (5) of the Articles of Incorporation and Article (4) of the Company's Articles of Association, and amendment of the codes from local codes to international codes for the purposes for which the company was established, which are:
(Text before amendment)
The purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Receiving and re-broadcasting satellite channels to subscribers in exchange for a periodic subscription.
2- Importing, exporting, and trading in equipment and devices necessary for the company.
3- Establishing buildings and maintenance workshops necessary for the company's purposes.
4- Advertising and publicity within the scope of the company's activity, represented by re-broadcasting satellite channels.
5- The company shall conduct the aforementioned activities within Kuwait only.
6- Establishing and implementing the necessary infrastructure for the company's purposes.
7- Establishing and managing studios for artistic production.
8- Security devices and systems, their installation and maintenance.
9- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized entities and companies.
The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait or abroad. It may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such entities.
(Text after amendment)
1- Project Management (821110).
2- Security devices and systems, their installation and maintenance (465998).
3- Investing financial surpluses in financial portfolios by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities (649918).

Practice No. (L.Sh. 2024/231) <orig>ل.ش. 2024/231</orig> concerning comprehensive operation and maintenance works for the traffic management system on the road network for the General Department of Traffic / Al-Idara Al-Amma lil-Murur <orig>الإدارة العامة للمرور</orig> – at the Ministry of Interior / Wizarat Al-Dakhiliya <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
Therefore, specialized companies / establishments in this field are requested to refer to the General Department of Financial Affairs / Al-Idara Al-Amma lil-Shu'un Al-Maliya <orig>الإدارة العامة للشئون المالية</orig>, Tenders Department / Idarat Al-Munakasat <orig>إدارة المناقصات</orig> (in Al-Ardiya Industrial Area / Al-Ardiya Al-Sina'iya <orig>العارضية الصناعية</orig>) to obtain the documents for this practice against a non-refundable fee of (3,500) K.D. (three thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) (via K-Net). An initial guarantee of (350,000) K.D. (three hundred fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) must be submitted, valid for (90 days) (to be attached to the financial offer for the practice), noting that the final insurance for the practice is (10%) of the total contract value.
They must bring a copy of the practice announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), and the following documents:
- A valid registration receipt with the Ministry of Interior / Wizarat Al-Dakhiliya <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>. Or
- A registration application for registration with the Ministry, and then to purchase the practice documents.
Please note that the closing date (submission of bids) is Wednesday, 2025/5/28, from (8:00) eight o'clock in the morning until (1:00) one o'clock in the afternoon. A mandatory preliminary meeting will be held with the companies participating in the practice on Sunday, 2025/5/14, at the headquarters of the General Department of Supply and Logistics / Al-Idara Al-Amma lil-Imdad wal-Tamween <orig>الإدارة العامة للإمداد والتموين</orig> at 10:00 AM to answer companies' inquiries. The subject of the dispute consists of a ground floor, a first floor, and a roof. The plaintiff stated that he did not make any modifications to the house and that it fully conforms to the plan submitted by the plaintiff on 23/10/2022.
The ground floor consists of a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig>, a living room, a bedroom, a kitchen, a driver's room, and 3 bathrooms.
The first floor consists of 4 bedrooms, a living room, a preparatory kitchen, and 3 bathrooms, 2 of which are master bathrooms.
The exterior cladding is ceramic and brick, the air conditioning is split units, the floors are ceramic, the windows and entrance doors after the courtyard <orig>الخوش</orig> are aluminum, the exterior doors are iron, and the courtyard <orig>الخوش</orig> floors are tiled.

**Secondly: Auction Terms and Conditions:**
1.  The auction starts at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
2.  Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
3.  If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was initially awarded.
4.  If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on the price.
5.  If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one else comes forward to bid, the bidding will immediately be reopened with a ten percent increase based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
6.  In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
7.  This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for it, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
8.  The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.

**Notice:**
1.  This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>

- Secondly: Auction Terms and Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall start at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price, in which case the auction shall be awarded to them.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those directly involved in the sale procedures, and under their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.
Notice:
1- This announcement for the mortgage auction sale is published in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership was divested is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

President of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

## Secondly: Auction Terms and Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall start with a base price of K.D. 355,500 (three hundred fifty-five thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by a full deposit of its value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.

### Alert:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."
