## First:

The auction shall commence with a base price of 1,050,000 K.D. (One Million and Fifty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Execution Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.

## Second:

Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.

## Third:

If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.

## Fourth:

If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.

## Fifth:

If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

## Sixth:

In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, expenses, execution procedures amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.

## Seventh:

This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those directly involved in the sale procedures, and at their responsibility, without the Court Clerk's Department <orig>إدارة الكاتب بالمحكمة</orig> bearing any responsibility.

## Eighth:

The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

**Notice:**
1- This announcement for sale by auction shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

New shares may not be issued for less than their nominal value.

Article (8)
If the value of the original shares has been fully paid, the company's authorized capital <orig>رأس المال المصرح به</orig> may be increased by a decision issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> after the approval of the regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, based on a reasoned proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and a report from the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> in this regard, provided that the decision issued for the capital increase specifies the amount and methods of the increase.

Article (9)
The company's capital is set at K.D. 1,000,000 – One Million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.

If a capital increase is decided and some shareholders do not exercise their pre-emptive right <orig>حق أولوية الاكتتاب</orig> to subscribe to the capital increase shares, the unsubscribed shares shall be allocated to those company shareholders who wish to subscribe. If subscription requests exceed the number of shares offered, they shall be allocated to subscribers proportionally to their subscription. In all cases where the new shares are not fully subscribed, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may allocate the unsubscribed shares to new shareholders, and the unsubscribed new shares shall be deemed cancelled by operation of law.

Article (10)
The company may increase its capital through public subscription <orig>الاكتتاب العام</orig> as stipulated in Article (160) of Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> No. 1 of 2016, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

Article (11)
(Optional text)
A shareholder's right to dispose of their shares is restricted by one or both of the following restrictions:
1- Requiring a pre-emptive right <orig>حق أولوية</orig> for the company's shareholders to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.

Article (12)
(Mandatory text if the first restriction in Article 11 of these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig> is adopted)
Before disposing of their shares, the shareholder must notify the company of the terms of sale. The disposal of shares shall not be effective until ten days have passed from the date of notification without any of the shareholders submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder comes forward to purchase the shares, this must be done at the price stated in the terms of sale.

Article (13)
(Mandatory text if the first restriction in Article 11 of these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig> is adopted)
Without prejudice to the provisions regarding the company's purchase of its own shares, if the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> rejects the buyer's person, it must purchase the shares on behalf of the company within ten days from the date the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> is notified of the request for approval. In this case, the purchase shall be made at the price at which the shareholder agreed to sell their shares.

Article (14)
Subscription
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> who signed the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> subscribed to the entire capital of the company with 10,000,000 shares (ten million shares), with a nominal value of (0.100 fils (one hundred fils)), distributed among them, each according to their subscription ratio specified in the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>. One Million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (K.D. 1,000,000) of the nominal value of the shares they subscribed to has been paid to Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig> bank, as per the attached bank certificate dated 15/4/2025.
The remaining part of the share value shall be paid within a maximum period of five years from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, and on the dates specified by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. If a shareholder delays in paying the installment due on the shares on time, the company must, after fifteen days from the date of warning them, offer their shares for sale to the other shareholders. The company shall recover from the sale price of the shares, with priority over all creditors of the shareholder, the value of the unpaid installments, interest, and any expenses incurred by the company. The remainder shall be returned to the shareholder. If the sale price of the shares is insufficient, the company shall claim the remainder from the shareholder's private assets.

Article (15)
Ownership of a share necessarily entails the shareholder's acceptance of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, the provisions of the company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, and the resolutions of its General Assemblies <orig>جمعياتها العامة</orig>.

Article (16)
Each share entitles its owner to a share equal to that of others, without discrimination, in the ownership of the company's assets and in the distributed profits.

Article (17)
The company shall have a special register to be kept with a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>, in which the names of the shareholders, their nationalities, their domiciles, the number of shares owned by each of them, their type, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded.
Any changes occurring to the data recorded in the shareholders' register shall be endorsed in accordance with the data received by the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig> to provide them with the data from this register.

Article (18)
Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>
Within three months from the date of subscription and before the meeting of the Founding Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of subscribed shares, the payment of due installments by subscribers, the names and addresses of subscribers, and the number of
<page_end>138</page_end>

### Article (20)
The invitation to attend the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting, including the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, shall be issued by one of the following methods:
1- Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2- Announcement, and the announcement must be made twice, provided that the second announcement is made after a period of no less than seven days from the date of publication of the first announcement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3- Hand delivery of the invitation to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4- Any other modern means of communication specified in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, and the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, date, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening for its representative to attend.
The Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting shall be chaired by whomever the Assembly elects for this purpose.

### Article (21)
The Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders with voting rights representing more than half of the subscribed shares. If this quorum is not met, the Assembly must be invited to a second meeting with the same agenda, to be held within a period of no less than seven days and no more than thirty days from the date of the first meeting. The second meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of attendees.
No new invitation shall be issued for the second meeting if its date was specified in the invitation to the first meeting. Decisions shall be issued by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting.

### Article (22)
The founders shall submit to the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> a report containing comprehensive information about all incorporation procedures and the amounts expended, along with supporting documents. This report shall be placed in a location designated by the founders for subscribers to review, at least seven days before the Assembly meeting, and this shall be indicated in the invitation to subscribers to attend the meeting.

### Article (23)
The Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be competent to address the following matters:
1- Approving the company's incorporation procedures after verifying their validity and conformity with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2- Approving the valuation of in-kind shares, if any, as stipulated in Article (11) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
3- Electing the members of the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
4- Selecting the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> and determining their fees.
5- Appointing members of the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> (if the company conducts its activities in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>).
6- Declaring the final incorporation of the company.
A copy of the minutes of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting, including the resolutions adopted, shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
The first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall publish the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> and register it in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> within thirty days from the date of the final declaration of the company's incorporation.

### Article (24)
Rights and Obligations of Shareholders
A member of the company shall specifically enjoy the following rights:
1- Receiving profits and obtaining bonus shares <orig>أسهم المنحة</orig> decided for distribution.
2- Participating in the company's management through membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and attending general assemblies <orig>الجمعيات العامة</orig> and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig>. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.
3- Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting, the company's financial statements for the expired accounting period, the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report, and the auditor's <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> report.
4- Disposing of his owned shares and priority in subscribing to new shares.
5- Receiving a share of the company's assets upon liquidation after settling its debts.

### Article (25)
A member of the company shall specifically be obligated to:
1- Paying the installments due on his owned shares upon their due dates and paying compensation for delay in payment.
2- Paying the expenses incurred by the company to collect unpaid installments of his share value, and the company has the right to execute on the shares to recover its rights.
3- Implementing the resolutions issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
4- Refraining from any act that harms the financial or moral interests of the company and being obligated to compensate for damages arising from violating this.

### Article (26)
The General Assembly of Shareholders <orig>الجمعية العامة للمساهمين</orig> may not do the following:
1- Increasing financial contribution burdens or increasing the nominal value of the share.
2- Decreasing the percentage of net profits to be distributed to shareholders as specified in the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
3- Imposing new conditions other than those mentioned in the articles of incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> or these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig> related to the shareholder's right to attend and vote in general assemblies <orig>الجمعيات العامة</orig>.
These provisions may be deviated from with the written consent of all shareholders or by a social vote <orig>تصويت اجتماعي</orig> involving all shareholders, and by completing the necessary procedures to amend the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.

### Article (27)
A - Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> consisting of (6) members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within the specified period, the existing board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease and a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is elected.

### Article (28)
Shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> by secret ballot. The company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> may stipulate that no more than half of the members of the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be elected from among the company's founders.

### Article (29)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall elect by secret ballot a Chairman and a Vice-Chairman. The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to other competencies specified in the articles of association <orig>العقد</orig>. His signature shall be considered as the signature of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in the company's relations with third parties. He shall implement the Board's resolutions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice-Chairman shall act in place of the Chairman in his absence or if he is prevented from exercising his powers.

### Article (30)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer <orig>رئيساً تنفيذياً</orig> appointed by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> from among its members or from outside, who shall be entrusted with the management of the company. The Board shall define his competencies and powers to sign on behalf of the company.
<page_end>139</page_end>

## Article (31)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may distribute work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board <orig>المجلس</orig> may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party to perform one or more specific tasks, supervise an aspect of the company's activity, or exercise some of the powers or competencies entrusted to the Board <orig>المجلس</orig>.

## Article (32)
Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة الشركة</orig> in proportion to their shareholding. The number of Board members <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig> selected in this manner shall replace an equivalent number from the total elected Board members <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig>. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining Board members <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig> except to the extent that their shareholding exceeds the percentage used to appoint their representatives to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in proportion to their combined ownership. These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as elected members. The shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

## Article (33)
A meeting of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern communication methods, and decisions may be passed by circulation with the approval of all Board members <orig>أعضاء المجلس</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must meet at least six times during the year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

## Article (34)
Minutes of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meetings shall be recorded and signed by the attending members and the Board Secretary <orig>أمين سر المجلس</orig>. Any member who did not approve a decision taken by the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> may record their objection in the meeting minutes.

## Article (35)
If a position of a Board member <orig>عضو في مجلس الإدارة</orig> becomes vacant, it shall be filled by the shareholder who received the highest number of votes among those who did not win Board membership <orig>عضوية مجلس الإدارة</orig>. If there is an impediment to that person, the next in line shall fill the position. The new member shall complete only the term of their predecessor. However, if the vacant positions reach one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must call for a General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> of shareholders to convene within two months from the date the last position became vacant, and elect those who will fill the vacant positions.

## Article (36)
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>:
1.  Must possess legal capacity to act.
2.  Must not have been previously convicted of a felony involving deprivation of liberty, or a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud, or a crime against honor or trust, or a penalty restricting freedom due to a violation of the law, unless their reputation has been restored.
3.  Must personally own, or the person they represent must own, at least one (1) share of the company. If a Board member <orig>عضو مجلس الإدارة</orig> loses any of the aforementioned conditions, their membership shall cease.

## Article (37)
Membership in the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة الشركة</orig> shall not be included in the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article (234) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>. A person may be the chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيساً لمجلس إدارة</orig> of more than one closed joint-stock company.

## Article (38)
The Chairman or a member of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس أو عضو مجلس الإدارة</orig>, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of their position to gain a benefit for themselves or others. A Board member <orig>عضو مجلس الإدارة</orig> may dispose of their shares in the company during their membership on the Board <orig>المجلس</orig>, without prejudice to the restrictions on share disposal stipulated in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the company's articles of association, or these regulations.

## Article (39)
Board members <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meetings, or to third parties, any company secrets they became aware of due to their management of the company. Otherwise, they shall be dismissed and held accountable for compensating damages resulting from the violation.

## Article (40)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> or any of the Board members <orig>أعضاء المجلس</orig> may not combine membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> of two competing companies, or participate in any work that would compete with the company, or trade for their own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity carried out by the company. Otherwise, the company shall have the right to demand compensation from them or to consider the operations they conducted for their own account as if they were conducted for the company's account, unless this was done with the approval of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

## Article (41)
The total remuneration of the Chairman and members of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس وأعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not exceed ten percent (10%) of the net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than 5% of the capital to shareholders (a higher percentage may be agreed upon). An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and each member of this Board <orig>المجلس</orig> from the date of the company's establishment until profits are achieved that allow for the distribution of remuneration in accordance with the preceding paragraph. By a resolution issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة للشركة</orig>, an independent Board member <orig>عضو مجلس الإدارة المستقل</orig> may be exempted from the aforementioned maximum remuneration (if the company has independent members). The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is obligated to submit an annual report to be presented to the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية للشركة</orig> for approval, provided that it includes an accurate and detailed statement of the amounts, benefits, and advantages received by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, regardless of their nature or designation.

## Article (42)
No person who has a representative on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, nor the Chairman or any member of the Board of Directors <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig>, nor any member of the executive management <orig>الإدارة التنفيذية</orig>, nor their spouses or second-degree relatives, may have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and dispositions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

## Article (43)
The company may not lend to any of its Board members <orig>أعضاء مجلس إدارتها</orig>, the Chief Executive Officer <orig>الرئيس التنفيذي</orig>, their spouses, or their relatives up to the second degree, nor guarantee them in loans concluded by any of them with the company, without prejudice to the rights of good faith third parties. (This provision does not apply to companies authorized to lend).

## Article (44)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and its members are responsible towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of authority, any violation of the law or the company's articles of association, or for mismanagement. A proposal by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to discharge the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> from liability shall not preclude a liability lawsuit. Board members <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not participate in voting on General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> resolutions concerning their discharge from liability for their management, or those related to a special benefit for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or a dispute existing between them and the company.

## Article (45)
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be either personal liability attaching to a specific member, or joint liability among all members of the Board of Directors <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig>. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable to pay compensation, except for those who objected to the decision that incurred the liability and recorded their objection in the minutes.

## Article (46)
The company may file a liability lawsuit against the Board members <orig>أعضاء مجلس الإدارة</orig> for errors that cause damage to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator shall undertake to file the lawsuit.
<page_end>140</page_end>

### Article (47)
Every shareholder may individually file a liability lawsuit on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be made a party to the lawsuit so that it may be awarded compensation if warranted. A shareholder may file a personal lawsuit for compensation if they have suffered damage, and any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.

### Article (48)
b - General Assembly
The annual ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within three months following the end of the financial year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors. The Board may call the General Assembly to a meeting whenever necessary. The Board of Directors must issue an invitation for the General Assembly to meet upon a reasoned request from a number of shareholders owning ten percent of the company's capital, or upon a request from the auditor, within fifteen days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be prepared by the inviting party. The provisions related to the founding assembly stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments shall apply to the procedures for calling the General Assembly, the quorum for attendance, and voting.

### Article (49)
Every shareholder, regardless of the number of their shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>. They shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote on their own behalf or on behalf of someone they represent in matters related to their personal interest, or in a dispute existing between them and the company. Any condition or decision that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder may delegate another to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney or an authorization prepared by the company for this purpose. Anyone representing a right over shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholder register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to obtain an order on petition to deprive the disputed shares of voting for a period specified by the judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.

### Article (50)
Voting for candidates for membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be subject to the cumulative voting system, which grants each shareholder voting power equal to the number of shares they own, entitling them to vote for one candidate or distribute their votes among the candidates without repeating these votes.

### Article (51)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>, their deputy, or someone delegated by the Board of Directors for that purpose, or someone elected by the General Assembly from among the shareholders or others.

### Article (52)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall, in its annual meetings, be competent to make decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1- The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended financial year.
2- The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3- A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4- The company's financial statements.
5- The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6- Discharging the liability of the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
7- Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and determining their remuneration.
8- Appointing the company's auditor, determining their fees, or delegating the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
9- Appointing the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> (if the company operates according to the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>), and defining its duties and report.
10- Reporting on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties. Related parties are defined according to International Accounting Principles.

### Article (53)
By a resolution issued by the company's ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, the chairman or one or more members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dismissed, or the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dissolved and a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders owning no less than one-quarter of the company's issued capital.
When a resolution is issued to dissolve the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and amend the election of a new board at the same meeting, the Assembly may decide either that this board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the new board is elected, within one month of its appointment.

### Article (54)
The ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss matters not included in the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or were discovered during the meeting, or if requested by a regulatory authority <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, the auditor, or a number of shareholders owning five percent of the company's capital. If, during the discussion, it becomes apparent that the information related to some of the presented matters is insufficient, the meeting must be postponed for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders owning one-quarter of the issued capital. The postponed meeting shall convene without the need for new invitation procedures.

### Article (55)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> unless those resolutions violate the law, the articles of incorporation, or these regulations.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must resubmit the violating resolutions to the ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in a meeting called to discuss the aspects of the violation.

### Article (56)
The extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or upon a reasoned request from shareholders owning fifteen percent of the company's issued capital or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must invite the extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> to a meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> fails to invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue the invitation for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

### Article (58)
The extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> meeting shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders representing three-quarters of the company's issued capital. If this quorum is not met, an invitation shall be issued for a second meeting, which shall be valid if attended by those representing more than half of the issued capital. Resolutions shall be issued by a majority exceeding half of the total shares of the company's issued capital.

### Article (59)
Subject to other competencies stipulated by law, the extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent in the following matters:
1- Amending the company's articles of association.
2- Selling the entire project for which the company was established or disposing of it in any other way.
3- Dissolving, merging, transforming, or splitting the company.
4- Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.
<page_end>141</page_end>

### **Article (60)**
Any decision issued by the Ordinary General Assembly shall not be effective until the publication procedures are completed.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the decision relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital.

### **Article (61)**
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit for the nullity of any decision issued by the Board of Directors or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly that violates the law, the company's articles of association, or these bylaws, or that is intended to harm the company's interests, and claim compensation when necessary.
Decisions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assembly that prejudice the rights of the minority may also be challenged. The challenge shall be made by a number of the company's shareholders owning fifteen percent of the company's issued capital, provided they were not among those who approved such decisions.

### **Article (62)**
(Company Accounts)
The company's financial year begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year, with the exception of the first financial year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register and ends in December of the following financial year.

### **Article (63)**
Annually, by a decision issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve for the company.
The General Assembly may stop this deduction if the statutory reserve increases, except to cover company losses or to ensure the distribution of profits to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of a statutory reserve that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits.
What has been deducted from the statutory reserve must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.
Also, (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> from the company's net profit.

### **Article (64)**
Annually, a percentage determined by the Board of Directors, after consulting the auditor, shall be deducted from the gross profits to depreciate the company's assets or compensate for the decrease in their value. These funds shall be used to purchase materials, machinery, and facilities necessary for their repair, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

### **Article (65)**
The General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the company's obligations under labor and social insurance laws.
A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.

### **Article (66)**
Annually, by a decision issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage may be deducted for the purposes determined by the General Assembly.

### **Article (67)**
The General Assembly, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, may distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the financial year, provided that for this distribution to be valid, it must be from real profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that this distribution does not affect the company's paid-up capital.

### **Article (68)**
Auditor
The provisions of Articles 227 to 233 of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its amendments shall apply.

### **Article (69)**
At the end of each financial year, the company must prepare a consolidated balance sheet and profit and loss statements for itself and all its subsidiaries, accompanied by explanations and data as required by International Accounting Standards.

### **Article (70)**
Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company
The company shall be dissolved by one of the matters stipulated in Articles 266 to 277 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations.

### **Article (71)**
The liquidation of the company shall be carried out as set forth in the provisions of Articles 278 to 295 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations.

### **Article (72)**
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations shall apply to all matters not provided for in the articles of incorporation or in these bylaws.

### **Article (73)**
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's head office and on its website, and an original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file at the competent department of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.

### **Article (74)**
The founders acknowledge the following:
First: That they have subscribed to all shares and deposited the amount required by law to be paid from their value in one of the local banks at the disposal of the company.
Second: That the in-kind shares have been valued according to the provisions of the law and have been fully paid.
Third: That they have appointed the administrative bodies to manage the company.
Fourth: Preservation of the required papers and documents for the aforementioned declarations with the official document.

### **Article (75)**
This contract was drawn up based on the letter of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> No. 2012202411834, registered with the Contracts and Companies Control Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> under automated number 6443875 on 2025/4/27.

The General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> issued, in its session held on 2021-03-04,
in Case No. **005970 / 20** – General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> Misdemeanors and Municipal Violations

Original Case No.: **202340180**

## Announcement
Regarding the determination of the closing date for Practice
No. (MOJ/2-2026/2025)
Supply, Installation, and Equipping of Mobile Security Rooms
for Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> Buildings

Further to the announcement published in the Official Gazette Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue (1734), Seventy-First Year, dated 2025/04/13, the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> announces to companies and specialized institutions in this field that the closing date for Practice No. (MOJ/2-2026/2025) Supply, Installation, and Equipping of Mobile Security Rooms for Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> Buildings has been extended, making the last day for submitting bids Monday, 2025/05/19, instead of 2025/05/05.
It is noted that there will be an addendum to the terms and technical specifications, and the schedule of quantities and prices, after their amendment, which can be obtained from the Tenders Department - located in the Ministries Complex Building, Block (14), Third Floor – Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشؤون المالية</orig>, during official working hours, starting from Sunday, 2025/05/04.

Technical Support and Preventive Maintenance for Alarm and Firefighting Systems at Kuwait International Airport <orig>مطار الكويت الدولي</orig> and Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> Facilities

A preliminary meeting will be held at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> headquarters on (Monday) corresponding to (2025/5/12) at (eleven o'clock in the morning), provided that the original purchase receipt is presented upon attendance, and only one person representing the company's residency is allowed.

Requests the release of the company's bank guarantees deposited with the Municipality in consideration of its classification.

Based on Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (2009/161) regarding the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel the classification, and the committee stipulated in Article One of this regulation shall issue its decision thereon after fulfilling the following two conditions:
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- The lapse of (15) fifteen days from the date of publishing this request in the Official Gazette.
The cancellation of the license or registration shall result in the return of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this resolution.
Accordingly, the Municipality appeals to anyone who has any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding building contracts concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial reservations in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the contracting agreement, to review the Contractors Section <orig>قسم المقاولين</orig> at the Engineering Systems Department <orig>إدارة الأنظمة الهندسية</orig> within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted after the prescribed period.

Director General of the Municipality

# Announcements
## Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>
Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. (4-2025/2026) related to the provision of fiber optic lines for Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> branches (backup) and the technical specifications for the practice, according to the details specified below:

### Tender Submission Requirements
The bidder must submit a technical offer and a financial offer in two sealed envelopes, one for the technical offer and the other for the financial offer, taking into account the attachment of a copy of the tender on a flash memory, according to the following conditions:
- The technical envelope must contain the following:
  - Initial security deposit in the form of a letter of guarantee for the amount of (KWD 2000) "only two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>", unconditional, valid against any reductions, and irrevocable, issued by one of the banks accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in its name and in favor of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>. This security must be valid for at least three months from the last date for receiving tenders. Any tender not accompanied by the full security deposit will be excluded. Initial security deposits may not be refunded until (90) ninety days have passed from the closing date of the practice or when the winning bidder submits the final security deposit and signs the contract, unless the practice is canceled. Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> will not pay any interest on the amount of this security, and the competitor's creditors may not seize its amount.
  - General and special conditions and technical data for the submitted offer.

  - Any other documents or data that the practice documents may require.
- The financial envelope must contain the following:
  - Tender form approved by the bidder.
  - Price lists and quantity schedules.
  - Any other elements that may affect the financial value of the offer according to the terms of the tender.
  - Any other documents or data required by the practice documents.

# Announcement

Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> announces the release of Tender No. (9-2025/2026) for the maintenance of (4) electrical generators (Jibrees) at its main building and its affiliated parking building in South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig>. Interested parties wishing to submit their bids should refer to the Bank to purchase the tender documents and technical specifications for the aforementioned practice, according to the details specified below:

## Conditions for the Submitted Bid

The bidder must submit a technical offer and a financial offer in two sealed envelopes, one for the technical offer and the other for the financial offer, while ensuring to attach a copy of the bid on a flash drive, according to the following conditions:
*   The technical envelope must contain the following:
    *   Initial security deposit in the form of an unconditional, free from any reservations, and irrevocable letter of guarantee for an amount of (250 K.D.) "only two hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>", issued by one of the banks accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in the name and for the benefit of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>. # Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>

Statement and Circular regarding the email approved by the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> or how to track companies wishing to register with Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>.
Please be advised that due to an unknown party contacting local companies in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> using an unauthorized email address, namely tender@kuwaitairwaykw.com, and requesting them to register with the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> via the email sent to them by that unauthorized party, in exchange for financial consideration and substantial fees.
Therefore, the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> wishes to clarify to all companies that the approved email address for registration, correspondence, and receiving any documents related to registration with the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> is the following approved Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> email address:
kwijtku@kuwaitairways.com
The Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> alerts all concerned parties to the necessity of exercising caution when communicating with unknown entities that impersonate an official capacity at the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> and request confidential data pertaining to companies dealing with the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>. Accordingly, the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> confirms that the aforementioned email address is the approved email address for the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>, and anything else is not affiliated with the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>, noting that registration with the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> at Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> is free of charge and without any financial fees.
This is for the information and awareness of all companies.
Committee Secretary
